abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Power Sector
            Rehabilitation Project in Uruguay are as follows: overall
            outcome of the project was rated satisfactory, and the
            performance of the Bank and the Borrower were also rated
            satisfactory. Some of the lessons learned from the project
            are: 1) this project has proven that the rehabilitation of
            an old hydroelectric plant is feasible and economical. By
            reinforcing the civil works and mechanical equipment of the
            dam, and by replacing equipment the obsolete components of
            the turbines and generators, and their auxiliaries and
            metering and control systems with state of the-art, the
            useful life of an hydroelectric station can be extended in
            several decades beyond its original life; 2) advance
            commitment of project financing sources is a key factor for
            expediting project implementation. In this case, the
            negotiation, approval and effectiveness of the additional
            financing required for the rehabilitation works of Gabriel
            Terra delayed the contractor to start field work by about
            two years; and 3) co-financing of an investment project
            through a B-loan can help a country with quick loan
            disbursement to cope with difficulties in serving external
            debt, but it involves complex negotiations and approvals
            that can impact negatively on the implementation of an
            investment lending operation.
